article.headline: IUPUI 79, Chicago St. 77
article.story: INDIANAPOLIS (AP) -- Austin Montgomery scored 23 points and Angelo Smith had 16 to lead IUPUI to a 79-77 win over Chicago State on Thursday. Montgomery scored seven points during a 16-4 run by the Jaguars (10-11) during the second half that gave IUPUI a 71-62 lead with 1:53 left in the game. The Jaguars led by eight points with 24 seconds left, but the Cougars responded with three free throws by Aaron Williams and 3-pointers by David Holston and John Cantrell to pull within 78-77 with two seconds remaining. Smith then was fouled and hit one of his two free-throw shots to give IUPUI the final margin. Royce Parran led Chicago State (8-18) with 19 points, with Williams scoring 14 and Holston and Kourtney Calvin each adding 12. Gary Patterson finished with 14 points for IUPUI and David Barlow had 11.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
